intro: Eremosis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, particularly the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Eremosis species are characterized by their small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. They have adapted to harsh environments with deep root systems and hairy foliage to reduce water loss. The plant's seeds are often enclosed in pods and can remain viable for extended periods, aiding in their survival in dry conditions.
